artists.name: Prince
artists.description: Purple Rain, Purple Rain! is the sixth studio album by the American singer, songwriter, producer, and multi-instrumentalist Prince. It was released on June 25, 1984, by Warner Bros. Records as the soundtrack album to the 1984 film of the same name. Purple Rain was musically denser than Prince's previous albums, emphasizing full band performances, and multiple layers of guitars, keyboards, electronic synthesizer effects, drum machines, and other instruments.

albums.name: Purple Rain
albums.description: Purple Rain is the sixth studio album by the American singer, songwriter, producer, and multi-instrumentalist Prince. It was released on June 25, 1984, by Warner Bros. Records as the soundtrack album to the 1984 film of the same name. Purple Rain was musically denser than Prince's previous albums, emphasizing full band performances, and multiple layers of guitars, keyboards, electronic synthesizer effects, drum machines, and other instruments.
albums.tracks: Let's Go Crazy, The Beautiful Ones, Computer Blue, Darling Nikki, Wednesday, Purple Rain, I Would Die 4 U, Baby I'm a Star, Father's Song

albums.name: Controversy
albums.description:
Controversy is the fourth studio album by the American singer-songwriter and musician Prince, released on October 14, 1981, by Warner Bros. Records. It was produced by Prince, written (with the exception of one track) by him, and he also performed most of the instruments on its recording. 
This was the first of his albums to associate Prince with the color purple as well as the first to use sensational spelling in his song titles.
albums.tracks: Controversy, Sexuality, Do Me Baby, Private Joy, Ronnie Talk to Russia, Let's Work, Annie Christian, Jack U Off

artists.tracks: Let's Go Crazy, The Beautiful Ones, Computer Blue, Darling Nikki, Wednesday, Purple Rain, I Would Die 4 U, Baby I'm a Star, Father's Song

artists.name: Max Rocket
artists.description: Max Rocket is my musical alter ego and stage name.

albums.name: Soulmate of the Month Club
albums.description: Quirky love songs, political screeds, and humorous sarcasm
albums.tracks: Soulmate of the Month Club, 1959, Pitstache, Hand Me Down Love, Everyday Love Song, Love is a Drug

artists.name: Sammy Davis, Jr.
artists.description: Sammy Davis Junior is one of the all-time greats and I would've love to see him in concert if he wasn't already dead and buried back in the 1980s probably give her retake or something like that

artists.name: Controversy
artists.description:
Controversy is the fourth studio album by the American singer-songwriter and musician Prince, released on October 14, 1981, by Warner Bros. Records. It was produced by Prince, written (with the exception of one track) by him, and he also performed most of the instruments on its recording.

This was the first of his albums to associate Prince with the color purple as well as the first to use sensational spelling in his song titles.
artists.tracks: Controversy, Sexuality, Do Me Baby, Private Joy, Ronnie Talk to Russia, Let's Work, Annie Christian, Jack U Off
